org.openimaj.image.renderer

Class ImageRenderer<Q,I extends Image<Q,I>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.image.renderer.ImageRenderer<Q,I>
  • Type Parameters:
    Q - Pixel type
    I - Image type
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FImageRenderer, MultiBandRenderer, SVGRenderer

    public abstract class ImageRenderer<Q,I extends Image<Q,I>>
extends Object
    ImageRenderer is the abstract base class for all renderers capable of drawing to images.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • drawConnectedPoints

        public void drawConnectedPoints(List<? extends Point2d> pts,
                       Q col)
        Draw onto this image lines drawn with the given colour between the points given. No points are drawn.
        Parameters:
        pts - The point list to draw onto this image.
        col - The colour to draw the lines

      • drawImage

        public void drawImage(I image,
             int x,
             int y)
        Draw into this image the provided image at the given coordinates. Parts of the image outside the bounds of this image will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        image - The image to draw.
        x - The x-coordinate of the top-left of the image
        y - The y-coordinate of the top-left of the image

      • drawImage

        public void drawImage(I image,
             int x,
             int y,
             Q... ignoreList)
        Draw into this image the provided image at the given coordinates ignoring certain pixels. Parts of the image outside the bounds of this image will be ignored. Pixels in the ignore list will be stripped from the image to draw.
        Parameters:
        image - The image to draw.
        x - The x-coordinate of the top-left of the image
        y - The y-coordinate of the top-left of the image
        ignoreList - The list of pixels to ignore when copying the image

      • drawLine

        public abstract void drawLine(int x1,
            int y1,
            double theta,
            int length,
            int thickness,
            Q col)
        Draw a line from the coordinates specified by (x1,y1) at an angle of theta with the given length, thickness and colour.
        Parameters:
        x1 - The x-coordinate to start the line.
        y1 - The y-coordinate to start the line.
        theta - The angle at which to draw the line.
        length - The length to draw the line.
        thickness - The thickness to draw the line.
        col - The colour to draw the line.

      • drawLine

        public void drawLine(int x1,
            int y1,
            double theta,
            int length,
            Q col)
        Draw a line from the coordinates specified by (x1,y1) at an angle of theta with the given length and colour. Line-thickness will be 1.
        Parameters:
        x1 - The x-coordinate to start the line.
        y1 - The y-coordinate to start the line.
        theta - The angle at which to draw the line.
        length - The length to draw the line.
        col - The colour to draw the line.

      • drawLine

        public abstract void drawLine(int x0,
            int y0,
            int x1,
            int y1,
            int thickness,
            Q col)
        Draw a line from the coordinates specified by (x0,y0) to the coordinates specified by (x1,y1) using the given color and thickness.
        Parameters:
        x0 - The x-coordinate at the start of the line.
        y0 - The y-coordinate at the start of the line.
        x1 - The x-coordinate at the end of the line.
        y1 - The y-coordinate at the end of the line.
        thickness - The thickness which to draw the line.
        col - The colour in which to draw the line.

      • drawLine

        y0 - The y-coordinate at the start of the line.

        y1 - The y-coordinate at the end of the line.
        thickness - The thickness which to draw the line.
        col - The colour in which to draw the line.

      • drawLine

        public void drawLine(int x0,
            int y0,
            int x1,
            int y1,
            Q col)
        Draw a line from the coordinates specified by (x0,y0) to (x1,y1) using the given colour. The line thickness will be 1 pixel.
        Parameters:
        x0 - The x-coordinate at the start of the line.
        y0 - The y-coordinate at the start of the line.
        x1 - The x-coordinate at the end of the line.
        y1 - The y-coordinate at the end of the line.
        col - The colour in which to draw the line.

      • drawLine

        public void drawLine(Point2d p1,
            Point2d p2,
            Q col)
        Draw a line from the coordinates specified by (x0,y0) to (x1,y1) using the given colour. The line thickness will be 1 pixel.
        Parameters:
        p1 - The coordinate of the start of the line.
        p2 - The coordinate of the end of the line.
        col - The colour in which to draw the line.

            int thickness,
            Q col)

        Parameters:

        p2 - The coordinate of the end of the line.
        thickness - the stroke width
        col - The colour in which to draw the line.

        Parameters:
        p - The polygon to draw.
        col - The colour to draw the polygon in.

      • drawCubicBezier

        public Point2d[] drawCubicBezier(Point2d p1,
                        Point2d p2,
                        Point2d c1,
                        Point2d c2,
                        int thickness,
                        Q col)
        Draw a cubic Bezier curve into the image with 100 point accuracy.
        Parameters:
        p1 - One end point of the line
        p2 - The other end point of the line
        c1 - The control point associated with p1
        c2 - The control point associated with p2
        thickness - The thickness to draw the line
        col - The colour to draw the line
        Returns:
        The points along the bezier curve

      • drawQuadBezier

                       Point2d c1,

                       Q colour)
        Draw a Quadratic Bezier curve
        Parameters:
        p1 -
        p2 -
        c1 -
        thickness -
        colour -
        Returns:
        a set of points on the curve
